newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Central Bank buying stunts Philippine peso's rise.
newsitem.headline: Central Bank buying stunts Philippine peso's rise.

text.p: The Philippine peso ended slightly firmer at 26.287 to the dollar from yesterday's 26.289 despite dollar-buying by Central Bank to keep the peso from rising further, traders said.
"The market was generally sideways. It was tempered by Central Bank which was in the market to keep the peso from appreciating too much," one trader said.
The peso was firmer due to the steady dollar inflow from overseas workers in time for the Christmas season.
Banks were buying dollars in the morning, pushing the rate down to as low as 26.292 to position for requirements by oil companies, but the peso quickly rebounded.
The market was quiet with turnover dwindling to $131.6 million as compared with $169.2 million registered on Wednesday.
Bankers expected the peso to rise further in the coming days due to the influx of dollars.
